symptoms.name: Acute watery diarrhea
symptoms.severity: Severe, profuse; sometimes described as "rice-water stools"

physical_findings: Signs of dehydration (e.g., dry mucous membranes, sunken eyes, decreased skin turgor)

lab_values.stool culture: Presence of toxigenic Vibrio cholerae O1, O139, or other toxigenic serogroups
lab_values.PCR: Detection of ctx or toxR gene

risk_factors: Consumption of contaminated food or water
Limited access to safe water, basic sanitation, and hygiene
Conflict, population displacement, climate events (cyclones, floods, drought)
Lack of investment in WASH services and infrastructure

required: Laboratory confirmation of toxigenic Vibrio cholerae from an appropriate clinical specimen (stool, rectal swab, vomit, blood)
supportive: Clinical illness (acute watery diarrhea, vomiting, etc.) in a person epidemiologically linked to a confirmed case
Detection of Vibrio cholerae nucleic acid (ctx or toxR gene) with or without clinical illness

differential_diagnoses: Vibriosis (caused by non-toxigenic V. cholerae or other Vibrio species)
